A **silver spear** is a type of [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a [stackable](/wiki/Stackable "Stackable") one-handed weapon that uses the [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear") [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill") and is made of [silver](/wiki/Silver "Silver").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [2.1 Average damage calculation](#Average_damage_calculation)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.3 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
  - [4.4 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [5 References](#References)

## Generation

Silver spears make up just 0.2% of randomly generated weapons. In addition to random generation, weapon [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop") and general stores can stock silver spears.

[Player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster"), including those generated on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane"), have a 1⁄580 chance (below 0.2%) of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a stack of 1-4 silver spears as their initial weapon before role-based replacements.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Strategy

As with most silver weapons, the silver spear deals the same base damage as a regular spear while being heavier, but deals additional damage to silver-hating monsters.

Assuming no additional skills have been unlocked via [sacrifice gift](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift") or [crowning](/wiki/Crowning "Crowning"), character in roles that can reach Skilled or better in spears (e.g. [Cavepeople](/wiki/Cavepeople "Cavepeople"), [Priests](/wiki/Priest "Priest") and [Rangers](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger")) may consider it as their silver weapon of choice, and it is one of the few non-restricted options available to [Monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk"). The silver spear does only one point less damage on average against small or medium monsters than a [silver saber](/wiki/Silver_saber "Silver saber"), and deals the same damage against large monsters (which includes most [major demons](/wiki/Major_demon "Major demon")), making it an attractive two-weapon option for roles restricted in saber.

### Average damage calculation

The average damage calculations in the following table do not include bonuses from [weapon skills](/wiki/Skill "Skill"), [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength"), or from using a [blessed](/wiki/Blessed "Blessed") weapon against [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead") or demons.

## History

The silver spear first appears in [NetHack Plus](/wiki/NetHack_Plus "NetHack Plus"), and makes its vanilla debut in [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0").

## Variants

In variants with [object materials](/wiki/Object_materials "Object materials") systems, silver spears are removed, and regular spears can have silver as an eligible material.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [Undead Slayers](/wiki/Undead_Slayer "Undead Slayer") have a 1⁄4 chance of starting each game with a +0 silver spear. [Lycanthropic](/wiki/Lycanthrope_\(starting_race\) "Lycanthrope (starting race)") characters in any role that start with a silver spear will instead receive a regular spear.

The [Holy Spear of Light](/wiki/Holy_Spear_of_Light "Holy Spear of Light") is an lawful and [intelligent](/wiki/Intelligent_artifact "Intelligent artifact") artifact silver spear that has +5 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") and +10 damage against [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead"). [Invoking](/wiki/Invoking "Invoking") the Holy Spear of Light permanently lights the dungeon in a certain radius around the character, dealing damage to undead and demons caught in the light - [unique monsters](/wiki/Unique_monster "Unique monster") have a chance to resist.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), spears can have an [object material](/wiki/Object_materials_\(dNetHack\) "Object materials (dNetHack)") of silver. [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai") know the silver spear as a **silver yari**.

[The Lance of Longinus](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Lance_of_Longinus "DNetHack artifacts") is a lawful artifact silver spear that confers [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance") while carried, and grants [half physical damage](/wiki/Half_physical_damage "Half physical damage"), [half spell damage](/wiki/Half_spell_damage "Half spell damage"), [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance"), and [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") while wielded, along with a bonus to [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") and [DR](/wiki/DR "DR") equal to half its enchantment - wielding the Lance of Longinus will also anger [demon lords](/wiki/Demon_lord "Demon lord") similar to [Excalibur](/wiki/Excalibur "Excalibur"). The Lance of Longinus has a 6⁄7 chance of granting invulnerability while [praying](/wiki/Praying "Praying"), even if the prayer is unsuccessful, and deals +3d7 holy damage against holy-haters while blessed, or +3d9 unholy damage against unholy-haters while cursed. Invoking the Lance of Longinus toggles the [water walking](/wiki/Water_walking "Water walking") property on or off.

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), in addition to SLASH'EM details, [Gladiators](/wiki/Gladiator "Gladiator") start each game with a +1 silver spear.

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), [tortle](/wiki/Tortle_\(starting_race\) "Tortle (starting race)") Undead Slayers start with silver [tridents](/wiki/Trident "Trident") instead of silver spears.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 155](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mplayer.c#L155): *1⁄2 to get a random weapon - the designated range of objects covers weapons from the spear to the bullwhip inclusively in objects.c, and uses normal generation odds*
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 275](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L275): *stackable weapons for player monsters*
